channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report X-2023080574
item.description:
Report X-2023080574

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: GRIMES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was left in QA wrapped in a flimsy plastic bag, leaking product with a strong fume. We immediately placed it in a hazmat bag and a black tote and removed it from the work area. DescribePack: One of the caps of the two containers and worked itself off the spout. Through movement of transport much of the contents escaped from the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We immediately placed it in a hazmat bag and a black tote and removed it from the work area. A DPR and ISF was completed and all contents, plus box and other items affected were placed in a Hazmat salvage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023080404
item.description:
Report E-2023080404

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 330 gallon tote of prochlor (un1760) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 5 ounces of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023080393
item.description:
Report E-2023080393

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the 55 pound cardboard box of HRH Powder (un3262) releasing 10 pounds of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023080238
item.description:
Report E-2023080238

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CEDAR RAPIDS AND IOWA CITY RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: IAIS carman inspection of outbound train discovered car leaking from bottom cap area. CIC Yard Manager was notified and the CIC carman secured a bucket underneath the car to catch any leaking liquid. Once the leak was contained the car was returned to VCP for repairs
